title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: members, contributors, leaders pledge make participation community harassment-free experience everyone, regardless age, body size, visible invisible disability, ethnicity, sex characteristics, gender identity expression, level experience, education, socio-economic status, nationality, personal appearance, race, caste, color, religion, sexual identity orientation. pledge act interact ways contribute open, welcoming, diverse, inclusive, healthy community.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Examples behavior contributes positive environment community include: Demonstrating empathy kindness toward people respectful differing opinions, viewpoints, experiences Giving gracefully accepting constructive feedback Accepting responsibility apologizing affected mistakes, learning experience Focusing best just us individuals, overall community Examples unacceptable behavior include: use sexualized language imagery, sexual attention advances kind Trolling, insulting derogatory comments, personal political attacks Public private harassment Publishing others’ private information, physical email address, without explicit permission conduct reasonably considered inappropriate professional setting

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community leaders responsible clarifying enforcing standards acceptable behavior take appropriate fair corrective action response behavior deem inappropriate, threatening, offensive, harmful. Community leaders right responsibility remove, edit, reject comments, commits, code, wiki edits, issues, contributions aligned Code Conduct, communicate reasons moderation decisions appropriate.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Code Conduct applies within community spaces, also applies individual officially representing community public spaces. Examples representing community include using official e-mail address, posting via official social media account, acting appointed representative online offline event.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Instances abusive, harassing, otherwise unacceptable behavior may reported community leaders responsible enforcement codeofconduct@posit.co. complaints reviewed investigated promptly fairly. community leaders obligated respect privacy security reporter incident.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community leaders follow Community Impact Guidelines determining consequences action deem violation Code Conduct:

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: Use inappropriate language behavior deemed unprofessional unwelcome community. Consequence: private, written warning community leaders, providing clarity around nature violation explanation behavior inappropriate. public apology may requested.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: violation single incident series actions. Consequence: warning consequences continued behavior. interaction people involved, including unsolicited interaction enforcing Code Conduct, specified period time. includes avoiding interactions community spaces well external channels like social media. Violating terms may lead temporary permanent ban.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: serious violation community standards, including sustained inappropriate behavior. Consequence: temporary ban sort interaction public communication community specified period time. public private interaction people involved, including unsolicited interaction enforcing Code Conduct, allowed period. Violating terms may lead permanent ban.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: Demonstrating pattern violation community standards, including sustained inappropriate behavior, harassment individual, aggression toward disparagement classes individuals. Consequence: permanent ban sort public interaction within community.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Code Conduct adapted Contributor Covenant, version 2.1, available https://www.contributor-covenant.org/version/2/1/code_of_conduct.html. Community Impact Guidelines inspired [Mozilla’s code conduct enforcement ladder][https://github.com/mozilla/inclusion]. answers common questions code conduct, see FAQ https://www.contributor-covenant.org/faq. Translations available https://www.contributor-covenant.org/translations.

title: Contributing to impIndicator
text: outlines propose change impIndicator. detailed discussion contributing tidyverse packages, please see development contributing guide code review principles.

title: Contributing to impIndicator
text: can fix typos, spelling mistakes, grammatical errors documentation directly using GitHub web interface, long changes made source file. generally means ’ll need edit roxygen2 comments .R, .Rd file. can find .R file generates .Rd reading comment first line.

title: Contributing to impIndicator
text: want make bigger change, ’s good idea first file issue make sure someone team agrees ’s needed. ’ve found bug, please file issue illustrates bug minimal reprex (also help write unit test, needed). See guide create great issue advice.

title: Contributing to impIndicator
text: Fork package clone onto computer. haven’t done , recommend using usethis::create_from_github("b-cubed-eu/impIndicator", fork = TRUE). Install development dependencies devtools::install_dev_deps(), make sure package passes R CMD check running devtools::check(). R CMD check doesn’t pass cleanly, ’s good idea ask help continuing. Create Git branch pull request (PR). recommend using usethis::pr_init("brief-description--change"). Make changes, commit git, create PR running usethis::pr_push(), following prompts browser. title PR briefly describe change. body PR contain Fixes #issue-number. user-facing changes, add bullet top NEWS.md (.e. just first header). Follow style described https://style.tidyverse.org/news.html.

title: Contributing to impIndicator
text: New code follow tidyverse style guide. can use styler package apply styles, please don’t restyle code nothing PR. use roxygen2, Markdown syntax, documentation. use testthat unit tests. Contributions test cases included easier accept.

title: Contributing to impIndicator
text: Please note impIndicator project released Contributor Code Conduct. contributing project agree abide terms.

what: Process GBIF data from the environment
title: Prepare_data
text: import GBIF data using read.csv(), readr::read_csv(), readxl::read_excel() based data set format. region study given shapefile. cube sim_cube object. example acacia taxa
code: acacia_cube <- taxa_cube(   taxa = taxa_Acacia,   region = southAfrica_sf,   res = 0.25,   first_year = 2010,   last_year = 2023 ) #> Error in get(paste0(generic, ".", class), envir = get_method_env()) :  #>   object 'type_sum.accel' not found # view processed cube acacia_cube$cube #>  #> Simulated data cube for calculating biodiversity indicators #>  #> Date Range: 2010 - 2023  #> Number of cells: 354  #> Grid reference system: custom  #> Coordinate range: #> [1] "Coordinates not provided" #>  #> Total number of observations: 5123  #> Number of species represented: 25  #> Number of families represented: Data not present  #>  #> Kingdoms represented: Data not present  #>  #> First 10 rows of data (use n = to show more): #>  #> # A tibble: 5,123 × 6 #>    scientificName   taxonKey minCoordinateUncertaintyInMe…¹  year cellCode   obs #>    <chr>               <dbl>                          <dbl> <dbl>    <int> <dbl> #>  1 Acacia implexa    2979232                              1  2010      206     1 #>  2 Acacia cyclops    2980425                            122  2010      668     1 #>  3 Acacia saligna    2978552                              1  2010      206     1 #>  4 Acacia pycnantha  2978604                              1  2010      206     1 #>  5 Acacia mearnsii   2979775                            110  2010      215     1 #>  6 Acacia mearnsii   2979775                              1  2010      215     1 #>  7 Acacia mearnsii   2979775                              8  2010     1376     1 #>  8 Acacia saligna    2978552                              1  2011      206     1 #>  9 Acacia saligna    2978552                             15  2011     1312     1 #> 10 Acacia mearnsii   2979775                              1  2011      230     1 #> # ℹ 5,113 more rows #> # ℹ abbreviated name: ¹​minCoordinateUncertaintyInMeters  # view coordinates head(acacia_cube$coords) #>   siteID        X       Y #> 1      1 16.60833 -34.697 #> 2      2 16.85833 -34.697 #> 3      3 17.10833 -34.697 #> 4      4 17.35833 -34.697 #> 5      5 17.60833 -34.697 #> 6      6 17.85833 -34.697

code: @Manual{,   title = {impIndicator: Impact Indicators of Alien Taxa},   author = {Mukhtar Muhammed Yahaya and Sabrina Kumschick and Sandra MacFadyen and Cang Hui and Pietro Landi},   year = {2024},   note = {R package version 0.0.0.9000},   url = {https://b-cubed-eu.github.io/impIndicator/}, }

title: Impact Indicators of Alien Taxa
text: goal impIndicator allow users seamlessly calculate visualise impact alien taxa individual species given area. calculates visualises impact per site map. takes GBIF occurrence data EICAT assessment list. enables users choose various methods calculating impact indicators based different studies. impIndicator produces three main products can useful stated : - impact indicator impact indicator offers nuanced representation trends biological invasions area (local, regional, global scales). tracking increase decrease ecological threats time, product provides insights dynamics invasive alien species impacts, helping assess whether current management practices effective need adjustment. temporal analysis impact indicator enables targeted resource allocation, fostering proactive interventions mitigate biodiversity loss ecosystem degradation. - site impact site impact map serves visual analytical tool represent intensity biological invasions across different parts area. enabling spatial comparisons—provinces, states, conservation areas—highlights hotspots areas risk invasion impact. spatial data useful prioritising management actions, coordinating restoration projects, fostering cross-regional collaboration address invasive species impacts effectively. - species impact species impact produces trends individual invasive alien species, enabling species-specific impact caused invasions. data supports comparisons individual species’ impacts, revealing roles interactions within invaded area. species impact invaluable prioritising species-specific management efforts, informing eradication strategies, advancing research alien species’ ecological roles adaptation patterns.

title: Impact Indicators of Alien Taxa
text: can install development version impIndicator GitHub :
code: # install.packages("remotes") remotes::install_github("b-cubed-eu/impIndicator")

title: Impact Indicators of Alien Taxa
text: Markdown demonstrates computation visualisation impact indicator biological invasions using impact_indicator() compute impact indicator alien taxa, species_impact() compute impact indicator per species, site_impact() compute impact indicator per site. functions feeds species GBIF occurrence cube b3gbi::process_cube() using taxa_cube() Environmental Impact Classification Alien Taxa (EICAT) impact score species using impact_cat().
code: # Load packages library(impIndicator)  library(b3gbi) # Biodiversity indicators for data cubes library(tidyverse) # Data wrangling and visualisation library(sf) # Spatial features

title: Impact Indicators of Alien Taxa
code: # load the GBIF occurrence data for taxa  acacia_cube <- taxa_cube(   taxa = taxa_Acacia,   region = southAfrica_sf,   res = 0.25,   first_year = 2010 )  acacia_cube$cube #>  #> Simulated data cube for calculating biodiversity indicators #>  #> Date Range: 2010 - 2024  #> Number of cells: 369  #> Grid reference system: custom  #> Coordinate range: #> [1] "Coordinates not provided" #>  #> Total number of observations: 5559  #> Number of species represented: 25  #> Number of families represented: Data not present  #>  #> Kingdoms represented: Data not present  #>  #> First 10 rows of data (use n = to show more): #>  #> # A tibble: 5,559 × 6 #>    scientificName   taxonKey minCoordinateUncertaintyInMe…¹  year cellCode   obs #>    <chr>               <dbl>                          <dbl> <dbl>    <int> <dbl> #>  1 Acacia implexa    2979232                              1  2010      206     1 #>  2 Acacia cyclops    2980425                            122  2010      668     1 #>  3 Acacia saligna    2978552                              1  2010      206     1 #>  4 Acacia pycnantha  2978604                              1  2010      206     1 #>  5 Acacia mearnsii   2979775                            110  2010      215     1 #>  6 Acacia mearnsii   2979775                              1  2010      215     1 #>  7 Acacia mearnsii   2979775                              8  2010     1376     1 #>  8 Acacia saligna    2978552                              1  2011      206     1 #>  9 Acacia saligna    2978552                             15  2011     1312     1 #> 10 Acacia mearnsii   2979775                              1  2011      230     1 #> # ℹ 5,549 more rows #> # ℹ abbreviated name: ¹​minCoordinateUncertaintyInMeters head(acacia_cube$coords) #>   siteID        X       Y #> 1      1 16.60833 -34.697 #> 2      2 16.85833 -34.697 #> 3      3 17.10833 -34.697 #> 4      4 17.35833 -34.697 #> 5      5 17.60833 -34.697 #> 6      6 17.85833 -34.697

what: Aggregate impact scores for each species
title: Impact Indicators of Alien Taxa
text: often several impact records per species different mechanisms regions. need aggregate impact records species. impact_cat() aggregates impact using max, mean max_mech metrics used different studies. max: maximum impact score across records species mean: mean impact score across records max_mech: sum maximum impact per mechanisms
code: full_species_list <- sort(unique(acacia_cube$cube$data$scientificName))  agg_impact <- impact_cat(   impact_data = eicat_data,   species_list = full_species_list,   col_category = "impact_category",   col_species = "scientific_name",   col_mechanism = "impact_mechanism",   trans = 1 ) agg_impact #>                       max     mean max_mech #> Acacia acinacea        NA       NA       NA #> Acacia adunca          NA       NA       NA #> Acacia baileyana        3 3.000000        3 #> Acacia binervata       NA       NA       NA #> Acacia crassiuscula    NA       NA       NA #> Acacia cultriformis    NA       NA       NA #> Acacia cyclops          3 1.333333        8 #> Acacia dealbata         3 1.739130       39 #> Acacia decurrens        3 2.500000        5 #> Acacia elata            1 1.000000        1 #> Acacia falciformis     NA       NA       NA #> Acacia implexa         NA       NA       NA #> Acacia longifolia       3 1.869565       37 #> Acacia mearnsii         3 1.736842       27 #> Acacia melanoxylon      3 1.142857        8 #> Acacia paradoxa        NA       NA       NA #> Acacia piligera        NA       NA       NA #> Acacia podalyriifolia  NA       NA       NA #> Acacia provincialis    NA       NA       NA #> Acacia pycnantha        3 3.000000        3 #> Acacia saligna          3 1.952381       38 #> Acacia schinoides      NA       NA       NA #> Acacia stricta         NA       NA       NA #> Acacia ulicifolia      NA       NA       NA #> Acacia viscidula       NA       NA       NA

title: Impact Indicators of Alien Taxa
text: impact risk map shows impact score site, multiple species can present. compute impact risk per site, aggregated scores across species site needed. site_impact() uses max, sum mean metrics aggregate impact scores proposed Boulesnane-Guengant et al., (preparation). combinations aggregation metrics impact_cat() species site leads five type indicators, namely, precautionary, precautionary cumulative, mean, mean cumulative cumulative. precautionary: maximum score across species’ max site precautionary cumulative: cumulative score across species’ max site mean: mean score across species’ mean site mean cumulative: cumulative score across species’ mean site cumulative: cumulative score across species’ sum maximum score per mechanism
code: siteImpact <- site_impact(   cube = acacia_cube$cube,   impact_data = eicat_data,   col_category = "impact_category",   col_species = "scientific_name",   col_mechanism = "impact_mechanism",   trans = 1,   type = "mean cumulative",   coords = acacia_cube$coords )  # impact map # visualize last four years for readability plot(siteImpact, region.sf = southAfrica_sf, first_year = 2021)

title: Impact Indicators of Alien Taxa
text: compute impact indicator alien taxa, sum yearly impact scores site study region. correct sampling effort divide yearly impact scores number sites study region least single occurrence throughout whole year.Ii=∑SiNI_i = \frac{\sum{S_i}}{N} - IiI_i impact score year ii. - SiS_i sum risk map value, S={s1,s2,...,sn}S=\{s_1,s_2,...,s_n\} sns_n site score site nn - NN number sites occupied study years region.Note: method incorporated now. methods considered later.Note: function impact_uncertainty() developed use bootstrap method compute confidence interval indicator rather using geom_smooth() used .
code: # sum of impact risk map for each year  impactIndicator <- impact_indicator(   cube = acacia_cube$cube,   impact_data = eicat_data,   col_category = "impact_category",   col_species = "scientific_name",   col_mechanism = "impact_mechanism",   trans = 1,   type = "mean cumulative" ) # visualise impact indicator plot(impactIndicator)

title: Impact Indicators of Alien Taxa
text: compute impact indicator per species summing impact risk map per species correct sampling effort dividing NN.
code: #  impact indicator per species  species_value <- species_impact(   cube = acacia_cube$cube,   impact_data = eicat_data,   col_category = "impact_category",   col_species = "scientific_name",   col_mechanism = "impact_mechanism",   trans = 1,   type = "mean" )  # visualise species impact plot(species_value) #> Warning: Removed 9 rows containing missing values or values outside the scale range #> (`geom_line()`).

title: Impact Indicators of Alien Taxa
text: compare type impact indicators case study, provide plot can adapted user compare set method.
code: # plot all type of impact indicators types <- c(   "precautionary",   "precautionary cumulative",   "mean",   "mean cumulative",   "cumulative" )  all_impact <- data.frame("year" = unique(acacia_cube$cube$data$year)) for (type in types) {   impact_value <- impact_indicator(     cube = acacia_cube$cube,     impact_data = eicat_data,     col_category = "impact_category",     col_species = "scientific_name",     col_mechanism = "impact_mechanism",     trans = 1,     type = type   )    all_impact[type] <- impact_value$value }  all_impact %>%   gather(-year, key = "indicator_type", value = "impact_score") %>%   ggplot(aes(x = year, y = impact_score)) +   geom_line(aes(color = indicator_type), linewidth = 1.5) +   theme_minimal() +   labs(     title = "Type of indicators",     y = "impact score"   ) +   theme(text = element_text(size = 14))

title: Compute impact categories — impact_cat
text: Aggregate species impact categories impact data.

title: Compute impact categories — impact_cat
code: impact_cat(   impact_data,   species_list,   col_category = NULL,   col_species = NULL,   col_mechanism = NULL,   trans = 1 )

title: Compute impact categories — impact_cat
text: impact_data dataframe species impact contains columns category, species mechanism. species_list vector species' list aggregate impact categories col_category name column containing impact categories. first two letters categories must EICAT short names (e.g "MC -Minimal concern") col_species name column containing species names col_mechanism name column containing mechanisms impact trans Numeric. type transformation convert EICAT categories numerical values. 1 converts ("MC", "MN", "MO", "MR", "MV") (0,1,2,3,4) 2 converts ("MC", "MN", "MO", "MR", "MV") (1,2,3,4,5) 3 converts ("MC", "MN", "MO", "MR", "MV") (1,10,100,1000,10000)

title: Compute impact categories — impact_cat
text: dataframe containing aggregated species impact. max - maximum impact species. mean - mean impact species. max_mech - sum maximum impact per categories species

title: Compute impact categories — impact_cat
code: # read the impact data # eicat_data<-readRDS("data/eicat_data.rds") # define species list species_list <- c(   "Acacia adunca",   "Acacia baileyana",   "Acacia binervata",   "Acacia crassiuscula",   "Acacia cultriformis",   "Acacia cyclops",   "Acacia dealbata",   "Acacia decurrens",   "Acacia elata" )  agg_impact <- impact_cat(   impact_data = eicat_data,   species_list = species_list,   col_category = "impact_category",   col_species = "scientific_name",   col_mechanism = "impact_mechanism",   trans = 1 )

title: Impact indicator — impact_indicator
text: Compute impact indicators alien taxa

title: Impact indicator — impact_indicator
code: impact_indicator(   cube,   impact_data = NULL,   col_category = NULL,   col_species = NULL,   col_mechanism = NULL,   trans = 1,   type = NULL )

title: Impact indicator — impact_indicator
text: cube list containing data cube class sim_cube processed_cube b3gbi::process_cube(). impact_data dataframe species impact contains columns category, species mechanism. col_category name column containing impact categories. first two letters categories must EICAT short names (e.g "MC - Minimal concern") col_species name column containing species names col_mechanism name column containing mechanisms impact trans Numeric. type transformation convert EICAT categories numerical values. 1 converts ("MC", "MN", "MO", "MR", "MV") (0,1,2,3,4) 2 converts ("MC", "MN", "MO", "MR", "MV") (1,2,3,4,5) 3 converts ("MC", "MN", "MO", "MR", "MV") (1,10,100,1000,10000) type type indicators based aggregation within across species site. type can precautionary, precautionary cumulative, mean, mean cumulative cumulative.

title: Impact indicator — impact_indicator
text: list containing dataframes impact indicator, species impact indicator sites impact indicator

title: Impact indicator — impact_indicator
code: acacia_cube <- taxa_cube(   taxa = taxa_Acacia,   region = southAfrica_sf,   res = 0.25,   first_year = 2010 ) impact_value <- impact_indicator(   cube = acacia_cube$cube,   impact_data = eicat_data,   col_category = "impact_category",   col_species = "scientific_name",   col_mechanism = "impact_mechanism",   trans = 1,   type = "mean cumulative" )

code: site_impact(   cube,   impact_data = NULL,   col_category = NULL,   col_species = NULL,   col_mechanism = NULL,   trans = 1,   type = NULL,   coords = NULL )

title: Compute site impact indicator — site_impact
text: cube list containing data cube class sim_cube processed_cubefrom b3gbi::process_cube(). impact_data dataframe species impact contains columns category, species mechanism. col_category name column containing impact categories. first two letters categories must EICAT short names (e.g "MC - Minimal concern") col_species name column containing species names col_mechanism name column containing mechanisms impact trans Numeric. type transformation convert EICAT categories numerical values. 1 converts ("MC", "MN", "MO", "MR", "MV") (0,1,2,3,4) 2 converts ("MC", "MN", "MO", "MR", "MV") (1,2,3,4,5) 3 converts ("MC", "MN", "MO", "MR", "MV") (1,10,100,1000,10000) type type indicators based aggregation within across species site. type can precautionary, precautionary cumulative, mean, mean cumulative cumulative. coords dataframe containing coordinates sites region.

title: Compute site impact indicator — site_impact
text: dataframe impact indicator per sites

title: Compute site impact indicator — site_impact
code: # define cube for taxa acacia_cube <- taxa_cube(   taxa = taxa_Acacia,   region = southAfrica_sf,   res = 0.25,   first_year = 2010 )  siteImpact <- site_impact(   cube = acacia_cube$cube,   impact_data = eicat_data,   col_category = "impact_category",   col_species = "scientific_name",   col_mechanism = "impact_mechanism",   trans = 1,   type = "precautionary cumulative",   coords = acacia_cube$coords )

Prepare Data Cubes — taxa_cube
text: Prepare data cube calculate species impact . function taxa_cube can take scientific name taxa interest character GBIF occurrences data containing necessary columns. GBIF occurrences downloaded scientific names given.

title: Prepare Data Cubes — taxa_cube
code: taxa_cube(   taxa,   region,   limit = 500,   country = NULL,   res = 0.25,   first_year = NULL,   last_year = NULL )

title: Prepare Data Cubes — taxa_cube
text: taxa Character dataframe. character scientific name focal taxa dataframe GBIF occurrences data must contain "decimalLatitude","decimalLongitude","species","speciesKey", "coordinateUncertaintyInMeters","dateIdentified", "year". region shapefile region study limit Number records return GBIF download. Default set 500 country Two-letter country code (ISO-3166-1) Country GBIP occurrences data downloaded. res resolution grid cells used. Default 0.25 first_year year occurrence start last_year year occurrence end

title: Prepare Data Cubes — taxa_cube
text: list containing sim_cubes taxa dataframe coordinates sites

title: Prepare Data Cubes — taxa_cube
code: acacia_cube <- taxa_cube(   taxa = taxa_Acacia,   region = southAfrica_sf,   res = 0.25,   first_year = 2010 )
